basics.name: Gabriel Nima B.
basics.summary: Professor and researcher in Dental Materials at Universidad de los Andes, Chile. I work at the Laboratory of Dental Biomaterials (BioMAD) within the Centro de Investigación e Innovación Biomédica (CIIB), with a research focus on advanced dental biomaterials, antimicrobial photodynamic therapy, 3D printing applications in restorative dentistry, and adhesive interfaces to dental tissues.

work.summary: Faculty member and researcher at the Laboratory of Dental Biomaterials (BioMAD), part of the Centro de Investigación e Innovación Biomédica (CIIB).
highlights: Faculty member in undergraduate and postgraduate dental programs, focusing on dental materials and restorative dentistry
Coordinate research projects focused on dental biomaterials and alternative antimicrobial therapies for dental biofilm control
Supervise and mentor undergraduate and postgraduate students in laboratory-based research projects

work.summary: Faculty member, responsible for the undergraduate course in dental materials.
Assistant Professor with teaching responsibilities for undergraduate and graduate courses in dental research and dental materials.

work.company: University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center
work.summary: Visiting researcher as part of a PhD exchange program, conducting a research project in dental biomaterials at the University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center.

work.company: Piracicaba Dental School – University of Campinas (UNICAMP)
work.summary: Teaching assistant in cariology courses, supporting laboratory activities, tutorials, and assessment of undergraduate students.
Provided comprehensive dental care in private practice, with emphasis on restorative treatments and preventive dentistry in Lima, Peru.

work.company: Universidad Nacional Mayor de San Marcos
work.position: Apr 2004 - Dec 2008: Student Teaching Assistant (Undergraduate Courses)
work.summary: Student teaching assistant in undergraduate dental courses, supporting practical sessions and student guidance.

education.institution: Piracicaba Dental School – University of Campinas (UNICAMP), Brazil
Piracicaba Dental School – University of Campinas (UNICAMP), Brazil
Universidad Nacional Mayor de San Marcos (UNMSM), Peru

interest.name: Alternative Antimicrobial Therapies and Emerging Dental Materials
interest.summary: Design of innovative strategies for biofilm control and caries management, including blue-light photodynamic therapy, cold plasma, and biofunctional dental materials, as well as the development and characterization of novel restorative and biomedical materials.

interest.name: Dental Polymerization
interest.summary: Investigation of polymerization kinetics and quality, with emphasis on depth of cure and degree of conversion, and analysis of the influence of light wavelengths, polywave systems, and polymerization shrinkage stress on restorative performance.

interest.name: Dental Adhesion and Bonding
interest.summary: Evaluation of adhesion to dental substrates, metallic surfaces, and 3D-printed materials, and development of experimental etchants to improve long-term adhesive durability.

interest.name: CAD/CAM and 3D-Printed Dental Materials
interest.summary: Characterization of additive and subtractive restorative systems in terms of accuracy, wear resistance, and mechanical behavior; establishment of adhesion protocols for 3D-printed restorative materials; and performance assessment of intraoral scanners, including trueness and precision.
